Description: Triptych; Embriachi type with certosina decoration; wood; ivory; bone; horn; carved; painted; gilded; stained. The exterior wooden wings painted with a red ground and on each leaf a bishop saint. The gabled central leaf with scrolling foliage, and on each side a figure of a saint holding a scroll. The stepped base comprising inlaid geometric patterns. The central interior panel comprising an l architectural niche in the Gothic style, surmounted by a cityscape. The standing Virgin holding the Christ Child and bird within the niche, surmounted by a half-figure of Christ holding a book. To the right of the niche a standing figure of St John the Baptist, to the left a standing figure of a bishop. The left panel comprising standing figures of a bishop and saint beneath an arch and cityscape; the right panel comprising standing figures of two saints.Traces of painting and gilding throughout. Horn ? and bone ? stained.
Production place: Made in: Venice (city) (probably workshop of Baldasarre Ubriachi)
Curator's comments: Of a type similar to those in the V&A (606-1861); Musee Cluny, Paris; Museo Civico, Bologna; Dahlem Museum, Berlin. The painted decoration on the exterior wings is thought to be commonplace on domestic altarpieces, even if this example may be later repainting. The left bone panel no longer fixed, and is removable. It is housed next to the closed triptych. BMcL 26.10.06
